intro: Torilis orientalis, commonly known as the oriental hedge parsley, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and the Middle East. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in disturbed soils or along roadsides. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal uses, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
